result.execSummary:
The defendant Viola Marie Pickens was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Conceal (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs, fees and surcharges by 07/08/16 or civil judgment.
Consecutive to: To any other sentence. Huber for work and treatment and release to the Day Reporting Center.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Viola Marie Pickens

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Viola Marie Pickens in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Viola Marie Pickens in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    Defendant ordered to serve 1 month in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with Huber Privileges for work and treatment, and release to the Day Reporting Center.
Defendant to pay all costs, fees and surcharges by 7-08-2016 or civil judgment.

Defendant Viola Marie Pickens in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant NOT produced. Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests case be set for plea and sentencing. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form.  Parties are notified that effective June 8, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Reserve Judge, Branch 45 in Courthouse room 515.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Home Depot.

ADDRESS INFO for Viola Marie Pickens
Current: 3332 N 29th street, milwaukee, WI   (Effective: 05-22-2015)
Prior: 6134 North 78th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53224
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT and portable breathalyzers.

Defendant Viola Marie Pickens in court and in custody with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Scheduling conference scheduled for 06-05-2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
